timeline.bodyText:
Plugin providing scalars would not work anymore, as they rely on the old function registry including old methods.
Is it worth to keep compatibility given that our plugin infrastructure seems to be unused?
timeline.author: seut

replies.bodyText:
s it worth to keep compatibility given that our plugin infrastructure

No I don't think so.
If people request this we can either create a narrow (Scalar)FunctionPlugin or extend the user-defined-functions to support Java as well - which would also avoid the deployment hassle

timeline.message:
Use Signature instead of FunctionIdent/Info

Replaced all usages of `FunctionIdent` and `FunctionInfo` with `Signature` and
marked them as deprecated.
Remaining usages are only for BWC inside mixed version clusters.
Implementation and usages should be removed with the next major version (5.0).
